citation.article-title: Arcobacter molluscorum sp. nov., a new species isolated from shellfish

p.s: Description of Arcobacter molluscorum sp. nov.
id="par0060">Arcobacter molluscorum (mol.lus.co’rum. N.L pl. n. Mollusca a zoological phylum; N.L. gen. Pl. n. molluscorum of molluscs classified in the phylum Mollusca).
id="par0065">Cells are Gram-negative, slightly curved rods, non-encapsulated, non-spore forming, 0.3–0.5 μm wide and 1–3.4 μm long.
Some cells have a filamentous form up to 7 μm long.
Motile by a single polar flagellum.
Colonies on blood agar incubated in aerobic conditions at 30 °C for 48 h are 2–4 mm in diameter, beige to off-white, circular with entire margins, convex, and non-swarming.
Pigments are not produced on blood agar.

All the strains grow on blood agar at room temperature (18–22 °C), 30 °C and 37 °C under both aerobic and microaerobic conditions with no visual differences, but growth is enhanced when 2% NaCl is added to blood agar.
Growth is weak in anaerobic conditions at 30 °C and in aerobic conditions at 42 °C.
No haemolysis is observed on TSA medium supplemented with 5% sheep blood.

Under aerobic conditions all the strains grow at 30 °C on MacConkey agar and on media containing: 0.1% sodium deoxycholate; 1% oxgall; 0.05% safranin; 0.0005% crystal violet and media with 64 mg cefoperazone l−1 (but growth is enhanced when the media are supplemented with 2% NaCl); and 2–4% (w/v) NaCl.
In addition, all strains only grow on media containing 0.005% basic fuchsin or 0.001% brilliant green if they were supplemented with 2% NaCl.
No growth occurs on minimal medium, media containing 1% glycine; 0.04% 2,3,5-triphenyl tetrazolium chloride (TTC) and on Campylobacter Charcoal Deoxycholate Agar (CCDA).
Strains produce oxidase and catalase activity but do not hydrolyse indoxyl acetate, casein, lecithin, starch or urea.
Nitrate is reduced after 72 h and 5 days for all isolates under microaerobic and aerobic conditions, respectively.
Hydrogen sulphide is not produced in triple-sugar iron agar medium.
id="par0070">The type strain is F98-3T (=CECT 7696T = LMG 25693T), isolated from a sample of mussels from the Ebro Delta, Spain.
